name: Palm Tree Heritage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had booked my Kerala trip fr 7 days via Antilog Vacations and it turned out to be a highly successful one. At my fiancé’s behest we decided to go for an offbeat place and decided against the run of the mill hill stations and beaches.
reviews.title: Varkala felt better with Palm Tree except for Govt. Power cuts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Varkala in southern Kerala particularly intrigued us as it was the only place in Kerala where cliffs were found bordering the Arabian Sea. We were a bit apprehensive as to whether we would get a package to this little known town.Antilog showed in true style why they are considered as the best for Kerala tours.They gave us a good itinerary & booked Palm tree for our stay in Varkala
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is managed by Babu, Reggie and Shyam and their helpful nature is really infectious as the rest of the crew is extremely cooperative. The honeymoon suite was not vacant and hence we got an executive deluxe room.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to relax

reviews.text: It was larger than we had envisaged at around 40 sqmt. A large attached bathroom and big balcony accentuated the size and beauty of the room. The mattress of the bed was a touch ragged though and given the other amenities, a better and comfortable mattress would have really completed the room.
reviews.title: Overrated - but good nevertheless !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The region seemed to be hard pressed for electrical power and hence a minor blip was the 30 minute load shedding every evening between 7 and 8 o’clock. But we usually took a stroll by the beach during that period and the cool sea breeze coupled with the glistening moonlight made up for the missing electricity and more. Moreover the lines of boats normally anchored itself during the dusk and this was quite a sight to behold.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in perfect location

reviews.text: Arrived on our first night in India, and WOW what a fantastic place to stay. Spacious rooms have carved wooden furniture and a very very comfortable bed. You cant stay anywhere much cleaner than this, and together with the amazing hospitality from Ragi, Babu, Jackson made our stay a wonderful experience. We only booked for 2 days but would have been happy to stay the whole week.
reviews.title: The Best!!

reviews.text: Thanks from Justin and Tracy and Johnny
reviews.title: Perfect happiness!

reviews.text: Katie and i arrived rather hot after travelling from Cochin by train. We were initially staying at another guest house near by but they had no power or AC so we were pulled into the Palm by Babu's friendly smile. If you go anywhere in or near Varkala then you MUST go and visit this amaizng place. The atmosphere and attitude is amazing. So so relaxing. Very helpful staff who also helped us organise trains, a boat trip and happy to offer advice on yoga and places to eat. Great rooms (wonderful bed) and service and the perfect place to have a gin and tonic watching the sun go down and the waves crashing onto what feels like a private beach. Thank you Babu, Reggie and Sham! We will be back!
reviews.title: Very nice place

reviews.text: We got into Varkala later than intended and had trouble finding the hotel we were supposed to stay at as it was dark. Babu saw us and came out to the taxi and said that he had a very nice room with A/C, and the other place did not (which was true). Initially, I was skeptical, but I was tired and we went with Palm Tree Heritage. Babu said that we could have the larger room for two nights, and if we wanted to stay longer, we'd have to move since it was already reserved. Being tired from the road, I agreed and was not disappointed. The first two nights was in one of the deluxe rooms. It was larger with large bathroom, cold A/C and big balcony. These rooms do not seem to be affected by the 30 minute rolling blackout every evening at 7 or 7:30PM. The only downside was that the bed is a little lumpy. Breakfast was included in the rate and it was very tasty. I loved the location. The hotel is actually in Odayam Beach, which is one beach down from Varkala (10 minute walk to the action in Varkala). The two nice things about this are, you can walk out from your hotel room and go right into the ocean. The beach is small, but it is there, very close and easily accessible. The currents can get strong so you have to pay attention in the water. Varkala beach is at the bottom of the cliffs, so no hotels that I saw in Varkala proper had easy beach access. The second nice thing is that Odayam Beach is more peaceful / quiet. My friend who I was traveling with liked to be in the middle of the action, while I liked being slightly removed from it. Again, it's not far from the action in Varkala, but it is not in the middle of all of the hub-bub, so this is really personal preference. I thought the location was the best of both worlds. We had such a good time here that we added, one night, then another, and then one more. For the last 3 nights, we were in the other building (which costs less), which is a short walk (2 or 3 minutes) from where the restaurant and beach are located. These rooms were smaller, with small bathrooms, but they were clean and comfortable (the A/C blew cold). For me, these rooms would have been fine for the entire trip, as I only went to the room to sleep and didn't need the extra room of the larger rooms. The food in the restaurant was good and the service was efficient. My initial impression was that I was skeptical of the hotel and staff since we were "steered" away from our original hotel. We couldn't find it, and Babu said that they didn't have A/C (which is true) and that we would want A/C (which we did as a storm rolled through our last night and we lost power and it got hot). Babu was right and I ended up really liking the hotel. I thought the beds in this building were better than in the more expensive room. Overall, the price was reasonable, although higher than what I would have paid at the other place. However, the need for A/C more than made up for the slightly higher cost. This hotel was not in my Lonely Planet, so I hope it gets added.
reviews.title: Just wonderful

reviews.text: Having intended to stay elsewhere, we were swayed by Palm Tree Heritage because of the offer of air conditioning in the rooms. It was the best decision we made all trip. The rooms were lovely (if a little eccentric), each one with a veranda and view of the beautiful little beach which we shared with the local fishermen and their nets.
reviews.title: A great experience

reviews.text: I was there at palm tree heritage between 5th to 9th July. I feel its worth for money. Babu is very courteous and always available for resolving any issues. I could say interiors of room is awesome.
reviews.title: had good experience

reviews.text: our trip to varkala beach was not a planned one,actually we were on our way to kovalam and we thought we'll have a look. We got some resorts list from just dial and selected palm tree heritage,it wasnight time and we had no choice,except staying.and it was worth our decision and was awesome.....,mr.bobby,a friend of mr.babu did an excellent service for our peaceful stay.that was a short trip and we really worried to start from there,the location was superb.that was a perfect and unexpected holiday for us.
reviews.title: A perfect holiday

reviews.text: We stayed in March 2011, for one week.
reviews.title: Lovely staff, great location,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good points are lovely beach side location, large clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, led by an energetic Babu, who did bend over backwards to make our stay a good one.
reviews.title: A total gem!

reviews.text: The bad points are that on arrival, and even having confirmed with the hotel on the day of our arrival , we found that our room had been taken, and would not be available until the next stay and we were put into a concrete annexe a few hundred yards down the beach. After some heavy persuasion our room was suddenly available at 9pm ...and I suspect that someone else was inconvenienced instead. Reading the reviews this seems to be a consistent story with others, and is complicated by the fact that there is the annexe that needs filling. I would encourage other guests to triple check their bookings and to perhaps insist on paying a small advance. I should add that Babu did not charge us for the first night, but it still did not make up for a poor arrival and first night that represented 20% of our stay.
reviews.title: Just a dream!!

reviews.text: This place is just wonderful. It is away from the main row of hotels which are along the cliff which we liked. It took around 20 mins to walk along to the beginning of the main row of restaurants and around forty minutes to the main beach. The hotel itself is lovely and Babu was extremely helpful in organising our trip to the next place. Great breakfast in the morning. Definitely recommended as long as you don't mind the walking. Bring a torch for the night walk home.
reviews.title: Fabulous relaxing place.

reviews.text: Our family comprising me, wife , and two kids of 6 years and 3 years age stayed in this resort during last week of September 2011, we conformed the booking through email, did not pay any advance (if I remember correctly) we were received by Mr Babu (one of the nicest guys I come across in my trips) and he offered a 2 Bed room property instead of the single bed room property we booked at no extra cost..
reviews.title: Nice stay with family

reviews.text: the room are so luxurious , the Bath room is almost as big as many Bed rooms in the match box flats of Bangalore ...
reviews.title: Wow!!
My Vacation....
reviews.text: He arranged auto for local sight seeing and suggested some good places ..

Babu tried his best to arrange a house boat ride at a reasonable price, but he could not get a deal so he arranged a country boat ride to a near by small island , which was a very nice experience .. My kids had a nice time in beach playing in sand and in the lawns of property.
reviews.title: Your private residence on the beach
